Author: pixcavator
Content: Good post! I think having a grand design ahead of time is good, if itÂ’s a good design. To me, this is about the scientific approach vs the engineering approach. You can get in trouble with either one. Option one: you have your grand design but nobody needs it. Option two: you keep iterating something but at some point improvement stops (try to cure cancer this way).

Author: floozyspeak
Content:
they did away with a-typical quicktime videos to explain the thing this time around, now its follow the GREEN arrow... i dunno if i like that, though it does appear simpler in my head vs a movie telling me how to use the app

looks like a good product, i could see using it for work, but like anything, i tend to be alone in that catagory at times, i'm still trying to get co-workers to see the light on social networks and heck photo-sharing..

Title: Startup Lessons from the Lockheed Skunk Works

Author: Readmore
Content: I've read alot about 37Signals and quite a few people have said that it's a really bad idea to compete with them. I'm personally not afraid, but I wondered if anyone had any input on that subject. The things I've heard are that you never want to compete against a company that is smart, fast, and small and 37Signals would be that company. Anyone have any thoughts?
